message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SD, cs.HC 

This paper deals with designing an artificial agent capable of interacting with humans in collaborative dialogue to produce creative, engaging narratives. This involves natural language processing, machine learning, and human-computer interaction, which are all subfields of computer science. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper involves probabilistic conversational agents, which falls under the sub-category cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also discusses controlling the rate at which the agent reveals information, which is related to machine learning and information theory, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.SD (Systems and Control) likely sub-categories as well. Finally, the case-study involves professional theatre performers, which falls under the sub-category cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction).
